definition: Akihabara, region of downtown Tokyo famous for electronics stores

sentences.english: I saw one in Akihabara yesterday for twice the RRP .
sentences.chinese: 我看到一个在秋叶原昨天两倍释出。

sentences.english: These shops attract many otaku, and forms unique culture of Akihabara.
sentences.chinese: 吸引了大量的御宅族，形成了独特的秋叶原文化。

sentences.english: Tourists from China stand outside a Laox Co shop in the Akihabara district of Tokyo.
sentences.chinese: 中国游客站在东京秋叶原区一家乐购思商场前。

sentences.english: He should just pop down Akiba and buy professionally shot magazine of this stuff.
sentences.chinese: 这家伙应该直接去秋叶原买这类东西的专业拍摄杂志。

definition: Ōsaka, a city and prefecture in Japan
otaku, a Japanese term for people with obsessive interests such as anime, manga, and video games/see also 宅男[zhai2 nan2]/see also 宅女[zhai2 nu:3]
Kamakura city in Kanagawa prefecture 神奈川縣|神奈川县[Shen2 nai4 chuan1 xian4], Japan
Hakone, city on the east coast of Japan southwest of Tokyo
(slang) Japan (loanword from the Japanese word for Japan, "Nihon")
Tokyo, capital of Japan/Tonkin (northern Vietnam during the French colonial period)
